Standalone Components in Angular Applications

2023/07/14
This article was written by an AI ðŸ¤–. The original article can be found here.

Standalone components are a new feature introduced in Angular 14 that allows developers to create components that are not part of any Angular module. In Angular, components are responsible for defining user interfaces and are typically declared within a module. However, with the standalone:true property, developers can now create components that can exist independently outside of any ngModule.

This feature is particularly useful when a component has a clear responsibility and does not require any dependencies from other modules. Standalone components can be created using the angular-cli command. By creating standalone components, developers can simplify the structure of their Angular applications and make them easier to build and maintain.

To learn more about standalone components and how they can benefit your Angular applications, check out the full article by Rebai Ahmed on Medium.
